Today Governor Newsom announced new guidance, which is linked below. Schools in the Widespread (purple) tier are not permitted to reopen for in-person instruction unless they receive a waiver from their local health department for TK-6 grades. Schools can reopen for in-person instruction once their county has been in the Substantial (red) tier for at least two weeks.

Placer County is in the Widespread (purple) tier. At this point, we will continue with distance learning through October 9, 2020, as previously negotiated with Auburn Union Teachers Association (AUTA). Our goal is not to just reopen schools, but to remain open. We will return to in-person instruction when we collaborate with public health officials to develop a plan to safely and successfully return students to school in a gradual manner.

Superintendent Update - 7-17-20

Gavin Newsom announced today that all public and private schools in California counties on the state’s monitoring list for rising coronavirus infections would be required to close for in-class instruction. In order for schools to reopen, the counties where they are located would have to have 14 days of a declining number of COVID-19 cases, as well as meet other CDPH criteria.

While we desire to open school five days a week with extra health and safety precautions, we must follow the state and local directives. If we see COVID-19 infection rates begin to trend downward, this will increase our opportunity to reopen schools in-person.

In my desire to continue to remain transparent with our AUSD families and the community, we must start our school year with a period of distance learning before transitioning to in-person instruction.

Dear Families,

The safety of your child while he/she is on our campus, is always our top priority.

We want to make you aware of a shelter-in-place/lock-down directive that was implemented at E. V. Cain campus this afternoon.

At approximately 1:45 p.m., the Auburn Police alerted our staff to shelter-in-place/lockdown E. V. Cain Middle School as a safety precaution due to a stabbing incident that took place at the Placer County Library Auburn branch, and that the suspect had not been apprehended. E. V. Cain Middle School administration and staff acted swiftly to ensure the safety of our students. Dismissal of students was delayed until Auburn Police removed the shelter-in-place/lockdown and announced an all-clear. At approximately 3:05 p.m., Auburn Police removed the shelter-in-place/lockdown.

We will continue to keep families informed when situations like this occur. Thank you for partnering with us to keep our students and staff safe.

Amber Lee-Alva
Superintendent
